title: Serif to pair with FS Me
content:
I’m building a new identity for our customer, and I’m looking at using FS Me from Fontsmith as their main typeface. However I’m in need of a We are building a new identity for our customer, and we are looking at using FS Me from Fontsmith as their main typeface. However we are in need of a serif typeface to use in longer body texts. FS Clerkenwell would fit nicely with FS Me, but it probably wouldn’t work in body text.

Any ideas? Thanks.

(I know Fontsmith will be rolling out some new serif faces next year, we are also looking in to those, just mapping out other possibilities.)

 [‹ Localised dollar signs](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172715/http:/typophile.com/node/17976 "Go to previous forum topic") [Arabic Fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172715/http:/typophile.com/node/38807 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kai.talonpoika

comments.content: Take a look at [The Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172715/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/theantiqua/). For some reason FS Me has a bit of a Lucas deGroot feel to it, at least to me.
Thank you, Chris. The Antiqua seems like it would pair nicely with FS Me.
